intro: Ornithogalum benguellense, commonly known as the Benguella star-of-Bethleem, is a bulbous plant native to southern Africa. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of white or pale yellow star-shaped flowers. The plant belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its underground bulb, which stores nutrients for growth. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
